review: I am kinda sad, since the new monetisation killed it. The core gameplay is still great, but I find the 5v5 format worse than the 6v6 as well as the balance is all over the place imo.  Overall OW1 > OW2. And when will you update HoTS?

I am forced to review  (THIS) game as an individual entity. So I recommend that game AS a co-op shooter if you need a break from your usual and better quality shooters. 

Overwatch (let's be honest, it's not "2") has been a solid 6/10 team based shooter for years. Simple as that, it's not epic, its not bad... it's just "solid". Remove the Activision/Blizzard tag - the game would do just as well. I'd give it a higher score if it weren't for the cash shops and seasons. That's not content and gaming to me. OW is 50% menus and seasonal challenges.

Played on BattleNet but downloaded here just to leave this review: matchmaking is shit, balance is shit, cosmetics are shit, monetization is shit, community is shit and Blizzard is omega shit. This games is trash and done to smoke, along with the company that makes it .

Even though I bought the original Overwatch, I didn't play the game before its release on Steam. After playing for a while now, I honestly can't say if I like it or not. The game plays similarly to the well-known Team Fortress 2, and it's filled with tons more characters and other stuff. Trying out each character and discovering their abilities is fun. The thing I don't really like so far is the length of the matches. I may be in the minority, but I wouldn't mind if each match was a little longer. Sometimes, especially if you are a newbie, the match can be over in ~5 minutes. That doesn't quite fulfill my crave for a good multiplayer game. It also doesn't make me feel like I want to play more. I would rather enjoy a single half hour match than a couple of 5-10 minute games.

I can't say much about paid content and the Battle Pass. If people want to pay for such content and want to be incentivized to keep playing in that way, then they are free to do so. If they don't like it, they can ignore it. As far as I know, it doesn't affect the gameplay in any way. Except for PvE content, that stuff is only available for $$$, I guess? Whatever.

It's hard to say how much more time I'll spend playing Overwatch 2, but I know it was worth a try. If you are a new player like me, I suggest downloading and playing a few matches to see if you like it.

i actually liked Overwatch a lot, still prefer TF2 but who gives a dam i like both. but im disliking this game to send a message as a person who has over 700 hours in this game, played since 2018 and is a grand masters torb player (if that makes my opinion matter more idk i thought it would be funny to mention) that this game got fucked up these past 2 years. im to lazy to explain why, i assure you the topic has been talked about to death do your own research. I really wanted that crazy PVE experience Jeff Kaplin desired. the future of this game is grim, but ill play it until it truly dies. if your new to this game, i dont see why you should not try the game its free now, dont fall for the crappy micro transaction and you might find joy in this game. i want to see Overwatch have a good future, but if the higher ups at Blizzard continue to be blind and brake promises (btw never trust gaming companies they are not your friends) this game is more doomed than a doomfist player
